Others: The Timberwolves recently made a massive trade that saw them trade Karl-Anthony Towns to the New York Knicks for Julius Randle and Donte DiVincenzo.
Minnesota sat most of their starters after the first quarter, but the contributions from some of their younger players allowed them to gain a 22-point lead.
Undrafted rookie Josh Minott was a pleasant surprise for Minnesota, as he scored 22 points while shooting 9-for-11 from the field and 4-for-6 from three.
